definition: to grow/to plant/to insert/to force on sb/to fall head first
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Landing headfirst in the water, he felt his pulse quicken.
sentences.chinese: 一头栽倒在水中后，他感觉到脉搏加快。

sentences.english: Old clan long eye a black almost fall down.
sentences.chinese: 老族长眼一黑差点栽倒。

sentences.english: Falling head over heels with your new shoes?
The black guy pitifully yells and crookedly plants on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 黑色盔甲者惨叫一声，歪歪斜斜地栽倒在地上。

sentences.english: Cameron ran hard to tackle him, hitting Jacob in the legs—with his head.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布正说着，卡梅隆却一头栽倒在地。

sentences.english: I lost my balance and toppled backward to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 我失去了平衡，朝后栽倒在地板上。

sentences.english: When you get home from work, you probably feel like slumping on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 你下班回家，你可能可能喜欢栽倒在沙发里。

definition: to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
